title: Energy and pd - work on particle - hole in shell

content.question: A thin, insulating spherical shell of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> has a positive charge <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> uniformly distributed on its surface. A small hole, which has a negligible effect on the shell’s electric field, is drilled in the shell’s surface, as shown in the figure. A particle of positive charge <math alttext="lowercase q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math> is then moved by an external force from an initial distance of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> from the surface, through the hole, to a final position at the center of the shell. Is the work <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> done by the external force on the particle positive or zero? What evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is positive. The particle moves in the opposite direction of the electric field outside of the shell.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is positive. The potential energy increases while the particle is outside the shell and decreases while the particle is inside the shell. The increase is larger than the decrease.
<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is zero. The electric potential is a constant inside the shell.
<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is zero. The distance moved outside the shell is the same as the distance moved inside the shell.

content.answer: <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is positive. The particle moves in the opposite direction of the electric field outside of the shell.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
